snippets.name: Demo - Time and Dates
snippets.text:
Text Blaze can insert the current date. Today is {time: MMMM D, YYYY}. You can customize the date formatting. For example, {time: MMM D} or {time: YYYY-MM-DD}.

You can also insert a date relative to the present. In 2 weeks, it will be {time: MMMM D, YYYY; shift=2W}; and in one month it will be {time: MMMM D, YYYY; shift=1M}.

Learn more about dates and times here: https://blaze.today/commands/time/

snippets.name: Demo - Forms
snippets.text:
Hi {formtext: name=your name},

Text Blaze has forms you can fill out when inserting a snippet. Forms can contain text fields, check boxes and dropdown menus.

Let's try this out:

A customer bought {formtext: name=quantity; default=25} widgets at a price of ${formmenu: name=price; 12.00; default=24.00; 48.00} per widget.

The total price of the widgets is calculated with a formula: ${=price * quantity}.

{formtext: name=your name}, you can learn more about forms here: https://blaze.today/guides/forms/

snippets.name: Case Memo - COR decision reserved
snippets.text:
I explained that the judge found they have all necessary requirements. They however are now in a waiting list to get their final approval.

They need to inform me of addresses changes or could be deported.
Cannot have any problems with the law.
Can renew their work permit 6 months prior to expiration.

Explained that we cannot guarantee a decision will happen prior to Kenia turning 21. So, 90 days prior to her 21st birthday we would file an expedite request. We will have an appointment for that and also each April (to update re the waiting time).

snippets.name: Case Memo - Affirmative asylum (full litigation at asylum office)
snippets.text:
Partnered woman, EWI from Guatemala without permanent bar. Has 3 USC children, one of whom has ADHD, anxiety, and learning disability with seemingly very intensive services.  
Has very good DV/gender/unprotected child asylum case. The DV was somewhat limited (1 month) but was very intense. She was also raped by an adult cousin.  

Partner has 2 recent DUIs. I explained he would be barred from COR.

Scope: Affirmative asylum (prep and file complete application, then get EAD, but not mandamus or interview prep/rep).

Attorney: KMC
LT: Lucina

Lucina, please do the following:

1-Ensure client is set up, and matter is set up. Note partner is NOT a client.

2-Prepare pp. 1-4 from I-589, and page 8 re trips back to Mexico, using Jotform questionnaire for asylum (or typeform if this has been migrated).  

3-Schedule TELA appointment for forms prep. Tell her this may  be reschedled if we do not receive questionnaire in time.

During this appointment, sight translate pp.1-4 and ask any needed follow up questions.  

Following your portion, hand off client to me and I will prepare pp. 5+  

4-Send I-589, G-28, and I-765 for each client.  Ensure we have received passports, birth certificate of client and children, marriage certificate, and 6 passport photos for each.

5-Meanwhile, I will prepare a case planning/case advisal letter for asylum and cancellation cases. This has a broad case overview, notes important info, and also will identify more specific evidence we need.  For example, it discusses work permits, in absentia deportation order, social security, medical insurance.

Once we send this there will need to be some follow up appointment with you to confirm we are moving forward to obtain all these documents.

6-While I am working on case plan, I will delegate to you to prepare the declaration.   

7-When draft decla is ready, I will review and call client to ask follow up questions if  needed.  Once complete, I will delegate translation of the declaration.  Then, I'll delegate to you to send the declaration to client for review and schedule an appointment to discuss revisions with client/confirmation of declaration and then ensure we get signature.

8-Once client has signed declaration, I will email psychologist Dr. Luis Perez a copy, background, and any supporting evidence such as prior mental health records, kids records, etc, and request a psych eval.

9-When draft evaluation is received, Kevin will review it and compare to the client's declaration to note (1) any new info and (2) any apparent inconsistencies.  Once resolved, Kevin will ask for signed version.

10-Once I-589 forms, basic ID dox, additional specific evidence, declaration, pscyh eval, and country conditions are received, we will mail file the application with USCIS by priority mail.  NOTE THIS MUST BE FILED BY 6 MONTHS AFTER THECONSULTATION AND THIS DATE IS ON STATUTE OF LIMITATIONS. WE SHOULD ADD A CALENDAR EVENT FOR THESE CASES DUE DATES.  

The asylum packet needs to have an original and then one copy for each additional family member. The signature page needs to have 1 passport photo of client or the family member.  When preparing these, we can assemble the PDF digitally and when mailing out carefully confirm that it is a complete digital copy of the entire packet being mailed.

11 - Once I-589 is filed, a 150 day waiting period begins for a work permit, which needs to be noted on the calendar.  Also, clients will need to be fingerprinted and return evidence to us.  Paralegal should schedule an appointment for 6 months after filing to ensure we have filed the EAD apps and clients have received EAD, and for me to check in. But clients needs to be informed to call if they have questions before this.  Also, EAD renewal date needs to be calendared.  

12 - Once asylum interview is scheduled, Will needs to schedule a testimony prep appointment 2 weeks before and ensure we have an interpreter (KMC has referrals and will put in Clio)

Thanks!!!

snippets.name: Asylee AOS
snippets.text:
Case assistant: Jesse

Client(s) names and relationship:

Married couple from Guatemala who were granted asylum (she was principal).  

Background:

They also have a U visa pending that was never withdrawn (would do so if they are granted adjustment).  

Criminal history:

She has no criminal history. He has an arrest on suspicion of DV but no charges.

Grounds of inadmissibility that apply:

Special humanitarian factors to emphasize:

Scope:

Scope now includes filing asylee AOS applications for both.

Jesse, please:

Ensure aspirational deadline to file of 60 days following date of receipt of initial deposit is on calendar as DUE date
Ensure contact information is complete, matter is set up with you as case assistant, both clients associated, correct language selected, and case type is set as USCIS AOS.
Ensure admin has scheduled client welcome call within 3 days of hire  

1-Schedule both clients for forms prep appt
2-Refer them to get their I-693 medical exams using USCIS civil surgeon website
3-Prep I-485, I-602, for both.  

3-Packet should include

G-28
I-485
I-602
Asylum approval notice
Copy of A05 EAD card
Copy of most recent passport (photo page)
Birth certificate for applicant
Marriage cert
Birth certificates for children
Psych eval for Mariela.

Let me know if you have questions. Thanks!

Received and processed notice of individual merits hearing from [City] Immigration Court by [ECAS/mail].{key: tab}Hearing is set for [date and time]. Completed the following: 
 
	1. Updated information in Clio custom field.
	2. Review calendar for confclits
	3. Entered hearing on attorney’s calendar and added case assistant as attendee: Ind Hrg [City] Immigration Court IJ [Name]. The hearing is [IN PERSON / INTERNET BASED].
	4. Scheduled 30-day evidentiary deadline ("All day") prior to hearing date: DUE - Dox due at [City] Immigration Court - [ eROP / pROP].
	5. Scanned and/or saved NOH to IJ folder: NOH REG MM-DD-YYYY.
	6. Prepared individual hearing letter to client(s), appended copy of NOH. Sent to clients via first class mail or posted on outgoing mail Slack CH. Saved copy of letter to lead client's Correspondence file, and shared via Clio client portal.

snippets.name: New Contract Email SPA TRUST
snippets.text:

snippets.name: Initial asylum email to client re proof and questionnaire (SPANISH)
snippets.text:
Introducción a su caso de asilo

¡Muchas gracias por confiar en nuestra oficina para llevar su caso de asilo. Este mensaje tiene como propósito explicar los primeros pasos para preparar su caso y cómo trabajar de la mejor manera con nuestra oficina. Por favor, léalo con atención y tome nota de cualquier pregunta que tenga.

Como comentamos, nuestra oficina trabaja en equipo en cada caso. Yo, Kevin M. Crabtree, soy el abogado principal de su caso. Su asistente legal (o paralegal) es XXX, cuyo correo electrónico es EEE y su número de teléfono directo es 628-303-XXXX. Al comunicarse con la oficina, por favor utilice este número directo. Si desea compartir nuestra información de contacto con otras personas, proporcione nuestro número principal 628-252-2020 y recuerde que nuestro sitio web es www.sfgreencard.com.

El primer paso, y el más urgente, es completar el cuestionario de asilo. Pedimos que todos los soliciantes en el caso lo llenen, pero para la próxima cita lo único indispensable es que el solicitante principal lo haya completado.

Es normal no recordar algunos datos exactos (por ejemplo, la fecha de entrada). Haga su mejor esfuerzo. Si no tiene cierta información, no es necesario pedírsela a otra persona si no se siente cómodo/a (por ejemplo, el domicilio de un hermano). El cuestionario solicita información relacionada con las preguntas de la solicitud de asilo del solicitante principal y es necesaria para su identificación.

El propósito de la primera cita es revisar su solicitud de asilo (formulario I-589) y confirmar los datos.

👉 Cuestionario: https://form.typeform.com/to/KjCHw6SV

Envío de documentos

Le recomendamos descargar la aplicación Clio for Clients o crear una cuenta allí. Recibirá una invitación por correo electrónico para acceder a su portal de cliente. Con esta aplicación, podrá enviar documentos de manera más segura.

Si prefiere enviarlos por correo electrónico, le pedimos que siempre seleccione “Responder a todos” para incluir tanto al abogado como a su asistente.

⚠️ No envíe documentos por mensaje de texto, ya que la calidad de las fotos es muy baja y no sirve como evidencia. Además, si su teléfono le pregunta al enviar fotos por correo electrónico si desea reducir el tamaño del archivo, debe elegir la opción de mayor calidad.

También puede enviar documentos por fax al 628-252-2020 o dejarlos/enviarlos a:

Law Office of Kevin M. Crabtree, PC
 www.sanfranciscogreencard.com
 550 California Street, Suite 303
 San Francisco, CA 94104

Por favor, recuerde incluir su nombre y número de teléfono en toda correspondencia.

Documentos recomendados

Le pedimos que nos envíe, en la medida de lo posible, los siguientes documentos. Si no los tiene aún, no posponga su cita; podemos avanzar sin ellos y reunirlos después. Sin embargo, contar con documentos de identidad y familiares puede facilitar el proceso:
	* Pruebas de identidad: Copia de la página con foto de sus pasaportes (el más reciente y todos los vencidos). No es necesario renovar su pasaporte.
	* Pruebas de inmigración: Copia de visas, permisos de trabajo, recibos o aprobaciones de trámites migratorios, formularios I-20, etc.
	* Pruebas familiares: Actas de matrimonio y divorcio (si aplica), y actas de nacimiento de cada solicitante y de cada hijo.
	* Pruebas médicas, escolares u otras: Cualquier documento relacionado con circunstancias especiales mencionadas en su consulta (por ejemplo, IEP, evaluaciones psicoeducativas, cartas médicas). Por ahora, envíe lo que ya tenga; podemos recopilar más después si es necesario.
	* Fotos tipo pasaporte: 6 fotos para cada solicitante incluido en el caso (originales--se pueden enviar/traer cuando firme su solicitud)
Si tiene alguna duda o pregunta, no dude en contactarnos.

Atentamente,

Kevin M. Crabtree
Abogado

snippets.name: Initial asylum email to client re proof and questionnaire (ENGLISH)
snippets.text:
Introduction to Your Asylum Case

Welcome!

Thank you very much for trusting our office to handle your asylum case. This message to explain the first steps to prepare your case and how to bet work with our office. Please carefully read this and take note of any questions you have.

As we discussed, our office works as a team on every case. I, Kevin M. Crabtree, am the primary attorney on your case. Your paralegal (or case assistant) is XXX, whose email address is EEE and direct telephone number in 628-303-XXXX. When contacting the office, please use this direct number. If you would like to share our contact information with others, please provide our main number 628-252-2020 and remember that our website is www.sfgreencard.com.

The first step, and the most urgent, is to complete the asylum questionnaire. We ask that all applicants in the case fill it out, but for the next appointment, the only requirement is that the principal applicant has completed it.

It is normal not to remember certain exact details (for example, the date of entry). Please do your best. If you do not have certain information, it is not necessary to ask someone else for it if you do not feel comfortable (for example, a sibling’s address). The questionnaire requests information related to the questions on the asylum application for the principal applicant and is necessary for identification purposes.

The purpose of the first appointment is to review your asylum application (Form I-589) and confirm the information.

👉 Questionnaire: https://form.typeform.com/to/KjCHw6SV

Submitting Documents

We recommend downloading the Clio for Clients app or creating an account there. You will receive an email invitation to access your client portal. With this application, you can send documents more securely.
If you prefer to send documents by email, we ask that you always select “Reply All” to include both the attorney and the assistant.

⚠️ Do not send documents by text message, since the photo quality is very low and not suitable as evidence. Also, if your phone asks when sending photos by email whether you want to reduce the file size, you must choose the highest quality option.

You may also send documents by fax to 628-252-2020 or drop them off/send them to:

Law Office of Kevin M. Crabtree, PC
www.sanfranciscogreencard.com
550 California Street, Suite 303
San Francisco, CA 94104

Please remember to include your name and phone number in all correspondence.

Recommended Documents

We ask that you send us the following documents, as much as possible. If you do not have them yet, do not postpone your appointment; we can proceed without them and collect them later. However, having 
identity and family documents may make the process easier:
	* Proof of identity: Copy of the photo page of your passports (the most recent and all expired ones). It is not necessary to renew your passport.
	* Proof of immigration status: Copy of visas, work permits, receipts or approvals of immigration filings, Form I-20, etc.
	* Family documents: Marriage and divorce certificates (if applicable), and birth certificates for each applicant and each child.
	* Medical, school, or other documents: Any documentation related to special circumstances discussed during your consultation (for example, IEPs, psychoeducational evaluations, medical letters). For now, send what you already have; we can gather more later if needed.
	* Passport-style photos: 6 photos for each applicant included in the case (originals—you may send/bring them when you sign your application).
If you have any questions or concerns, please do not hesitate to contact us.

Sincerely,

Kevin M. Crabtree
Attorney at Law

snippets.name: Individual Hearing Prep Email SPA (Concord)
snippets.text:
Estimados Clientes:

Fue un gusto saludarlos hoy y conversar sobre su caso. Su audiencia está programada para el [FECHA]. en el Tribunal de Inmigración de Concord, ubicado en:

1855 GATEWAY BLVD., SUITE 850
 9TH FL., CTRM 7
 CONCORD, CA 94520

Es muy importante que se presenten a su audiencia. Si no lo hacen, el Tribunal puede ordenar su deportación, salvo en circunstancias excepcionales (por ejemplo, una enfermedad grave).
Por favor, reúnanse conmigo 30 minutos antes en la entrada del edificio.

Mi número de celular es 510-332-4664.

Lleven consigo los originales de los siguientes documentos:
	* Carta de audiencia
	* Pasaportes de ambos (el más reciente y todos los demás en su posesión)
	* No es necesario renovar los pasaportes vencidos
	* Matrículas consulares, si las tienen
	* Licencias de manejo
	* Acta de matrimonio
	* Actas de nacimiento de sus hijos
	* Actas de nacimiento de ustedes dos, si las tienen
Si tienen alguna pregunta, no duden en comunicarse conmigo.

Cordialmente,

snippets.name: Case Memo - COR decision reserved
snippets.text:
I explained that the judge found they have all necessary requirements. They however are now in a waiting list to get their final approval.

They need to inform me of addresses changes or could be deported.
Cannot have any problems with the law.
Can renew their work permit 6 months prior to expiration.

Explained that we cannot guarantee a decision will happen prior to Kenia turning 21. So, 90 days prior to her 21st birthday we would file an expedite request. We will have an appointment for that and also each April (to update re the waiting time).

snippets.name: Case Memo - Affirmative asylum (full litigation at asylum office)
snippets.text:
Partnered woman, EWI from Guatemala without permanent bar. Has 3 USC children, one of whom has ADHD, anxiety, and learning disability with seemingly very intensive services.  
Has very good DV/gender/unprotected child asylum case. The DV was somewhat limited (1 month) but was very intense. She was also raped by an adult cousin.  

Partner has 2 recent DUIs. I explained he would be barred from COR.

Scope: Affirmative asylum (prep and file complete application, then get EAD, but not mandamus or interview prep/rep).

Attorney: KMC
LT: Lucina

Lucina, please do the following:

1-Ensure client is set up, and matter is set up. Note partner is NOT a client.

2-Prepare pp. 1-4 from I-589, and page 8 re trips back to Mexico, using Jotform questionnaire for asylum (or typeform if this has been migrated).  

3-Schedule TELA appointment for forms prep. Tell her this may  be reschedled if we do not receive questionnaire in time.

During this appointment, sight translate pp.1-4 and ask any needed follow up questions.  

Following your portion, hand off client to me and I will prepare pp. 5+  

4-Send I-589, G-28, and I-765 for each client.  Ensure we have received passports, birth certificate of client and children, marriage certificate, and 6 passport photos for each.

5-Meanwhile, I will prepare a case planning/case advisal letter for asylum and cancellation cases. This has a broad case overview, notes important info, and also will identify more specific evidence we need.  For example, it discusses work permits, in absentia deportation order, social security, medical insurance.

Once we send this there will need to be some follow up appointment with you to confirm we are moving forward to obtain all these documents.

6-While I am working on case plan, I will delegate to you to prepare the declaration.   

7-When draft decla is ready, I will review and call client to ask follow up questions if  needed.  Once complete, I will delegate translation of the declaration.  Then, I'll delegate to you to send the declaration to client for review and schedule an appointment to discuss revisions with client/confirmation of declaration and then ensure we get signature.

8-Once client has signed declaration, I will email psychologist Dr. Luis Perez a copy, background, and any supporting evidence such as prior mental health records, kids records, etc, and request a psych eval.

9-When draft evaluation is received, Kevin will review it and compare to the client's declaration to note (1) any new info and (2) any apparent inconsistencies.  Once resolved, Kevin will ask for signed version.

10-Once I-589 forms, basic ID dox, additional specific evidence, declaration, pscyh eval, and country conditions are received, we will mail file the application with USCIS by priority mail.  NOTE THIS MUST BE FILED BY 6 MONTHS AFTER THECONSULTATION AND THIS DATE IS ON STATUTE OF LIMITATIONS. WE SHOULD ADD A CALENDAR EVENT FOR THESE CASES DUE DATES.  

The asylum packet needs to have an original and then one copy for each additional family member. The signature page needs to have 1 passport photo of client or the family member.  When preparing these, we can assemble the PDF digitally and when mailing out carefully confirm that it is a complete digital copy of the entire packet being mailed.

11 - Once I-589 is filed, a 150 day waiting period begins for a work permit, which needs to be noted on the calendar.  Also, clients will need to be fingerprinted and return evidence to us.  Paralegal should schedule an appointment for 6 months after filing to ensure we have filed the EAD apps and clients have received EAD, and for me to check in. But clients needs to be informed to call if they have questions before this.  Also, EAD renewal date needs to be calendared.  

12 - Once asylum interview is scheduled, Will needs to schedule a testimony prep appointment 2 weeks before and ensure we have an interpreter (KMC has referrals and will put in Clio)

Thanks!!!

snippets.name: Asylee AOS
snippets.text:
Case assistant: Jesse

Client(s) names and relationship:

Married couple from Guatemala who were granted asylum (she was principal).  

Background:

They also have a U visa pending that was never withdrawn (would do so if they are granted adjustment).  

Criminal history:

She has no criminal history. He has an arrest on suspicion of DV but no charges.

Grounds of inadmissibility that apply:

Special humanitarian factors to emphasize:

Scope:

Scope now includes filing asylee AOS applications for both.

Jesse, please:

Ensure aspirational deadline to file of 60 days following date of receipt of initial deposit is on calendar as DUE date
Ensure contact information is complete, matter is set up with you as case assistant, both clients associated, correct language selected, and case type is set as USCIS AOS.
Ensure admin has scheduled client welcome call within 3 days of hire  

1-Schedule both clients for forms prep appt
2-Refer them to get their I-693 medical exams using USCIS civil surgeon website
3-Prep I-485, I-602, for both.  

3-Packet should include

G-28
I-485
I-602
Asylum approval notice
Copy of A05 EAD card
Copy of most recent passport (photo page)
Birth certificate for applicant
Marriage cert
Birth certificates for children
Psych eval for Mariela.

Let me know if you have questions. Thanks!

snippets.name: EAD Receipt Notice (Auto Extension)
snippets.text:
I received the Employment Authorization Document (EAD) receipt notice; an automatic extension applies.
{key:tab}
I reviewed the EAD receipt notice and confirmed that the automatic extension applies.
Next steps:
- Calendar a reminder to file for renewal six months before expiration.
- Create a task to pre-review the renewal packet and gather updated evidence.
- Send the client a packet (by mail and through the client portal) explaining the receipt and automatic extension.
- Scan the notice and upload it to the client portal.
- Request copies of both sides of the current EAD card for the file.

snippets.name: Case Memo - COR decision reserved
snippets.text:
I explained that the judge found they have all necessary requirements. They however are now in a waiting list to get their final approval.

They need to inform me of addresses changes or could be deported.
Cannot have any problems with the law.
Can renew their work permit 6 months prior to expiration.

Explained that we cannot guarantee a decision will happen prior to Kenia turning 21. So, 90 days prior to her 21st birthday we would file an expedite request. We will have an appointment for that and also each April (to update re the waiting time).

snippets.name: Case Memo - Affirmative asylum (full litigation at asylum office)
snippets.text:
Partnered woman, EWI from Guatemala without permanent bar. Has 3 USC children, one of whom has ADHD, anxiety, and learning disability with seemingly very intensive services.  
Has very good DV/gender/unprotected child asylum case. The DV was somewhat limited (1 month) but was very intense. She was also raped by an adult cousin.  

Partner has 2 recent DUIs. I explained he would be barred from COR.

Scope: Affirmative asylum (prep and file complete application, then get EAD, but not mandamus or interview prep/rep).

Attorney: KMC
LT: Lucina

Lucina, please do the following:

1-Ensure client is set up, and matter is set up. Note partner is NOT a client.

2-Prepare pp. 1-4 from I-589, and page 8 re trips back to Mexico, using Jotform questionnaire for asylum (or typeform if this has been migrated).  

3-Schedule TELA appointment for forms prep. Tell her this may  be reschedled if we do not receive questionnaire in time.

During this appointment, sight translate pp.1-4 and ask any needed follow up questions.  

Following your portion, hand off client to me and I will prepare pp. 5+  

4-Send I-589, G-28, and I-765 for each client.  Ensure we have received passports, birth certificate of client and children, marriage certificate, and 6 passport photos for each.

5-Meanwhile, I will prepare a case planning/case advisal letter for asylum and cancellation cases. This has a broad case overview, notes important info, and also will identify more specific evidence we need.  For example, it discusses work permits, in absentia deportation order, social security, medical insurance.

Once we send this there will need to be some follow up appointment with you to confirm we are moving forward to obtain all these documents.

6-While I am working on case plan, I will delegate to you to prepare the declaration.   

7-When draft decla is ready, I will review and call client to ask follow up questions if  needed.  Once complete, I will delegate translation of the declaration.  Then, I'll delegate to you to send the declaration to client for review and schedule an appointment to discuss revisions with client/confirmation of declaration and then ensure we get signature.

8-Once client has signed declaration, I will email psychologist Dr. Luis Perez a copy, background, and any supporting evidence such as prior mental health records, kids records, etc, and request a psych eval.

9-When draft evaluation is received, Kevin will review it and compare to the client's declaration to note (1) any new info and (2) any apparent inconsistencies.  Once resolved, Kevin will ask for signed version.

10-Once I-589 forms, basic ID dox, additional specific evidence, declaration, pscyh eval, and country conditions are received, we will mail file the application with USCIS by priority mail.  NOTE THIS MUST BE FILED BY 6 MONTHS AFTER THECONSULTATION AND THIS DATE IS ON STATUTE OF LIMITATIONS. WE SHOULD ADD A CALENDAR EVENT FOR THESE CASES DUE DATES.  

The asylum packet needs to have an original and then one copy for each additional family member. The signature page needs to have 1 passport photo of client or the family member.  When preparing these, we can assemble the PDF digitally and when mailing out carefully confirm that it is a complete digital copy of the entire packet being mailed.

11 - Once I-589 is filed, a 150 day waiting period begins for a work permit, which needs to be noted on the calendar.  Also, clients will need to be fingerprinted and return evidence to us.  Paralegal should schedule an appointment for 6 months after filing to ensure we have filed the EAD apps and clients have received EAD, and for me to check in. But clients needs to be informed to call if they have questions before this.  Also, EAD renewal date needs to be calendared.  

12 - Once asylum interview is scheduled, Will needs to schedule a testimony prep appointment 2 weeks before and ensure we have an interpreter (KMC has referrals and will put in Clio)

Thanks!!!
snippets.html:
Partnered woman, EWI from Guatemala without permanent bar. Has 3 USC children, one of whom has ADHD, anxiety, and learning disability with seemingly very intensive services.  

Has very good DV/gender/unprotected child asylum case. The DV was somewhat limited (1 month) but was very intense. She was also raped by an adult cousin.  


Partner has 2 recent DUIs. I explained he would be barred from COR.


Scope: Affirmative asylum (prep and file complete application, then get EAD, but not mandamus or interview prep/rep).


Attorney: KMC

LT: Lucina


Lucina, please do the following:


1-Ensure client is set up, and matter is set up. Note partner is NOT a client.


2-Prepare pp. 1-4 from I-589, and page 8 re trips back to Mexico, using Jotform questionnaire for asylum (or typeform if this has been migrated).  


3-Schedule TELA appointment for forms prep. Tell her this may be reschedled if we do not receive questionnaire in time.


During this appointment, sight translate pp.1-4 and ask any needed follow up questions.  


Following your portion, hand off client to me and I will prepare pp. 5+  


4-Send I-589, G-28, and I-765 for each client. Ensure we have received passports, birth certificate of client and children, marriage certificate, and 6 passport photos for each.


5-Meanwhile, I will prepare a case planning/case advisal letter for asylum and cancellation cases. This has a broad case overview, notes important info, and also will identify more specific evidence we need. For example, it discusses work permits, in absentia deportation order, social security, medical insurance.


Once we send this there will need to be some follow up appointment with you to confirm we are moving forward to obtain all these documents.


6-While I am working on case plan, I will delegate to you to prepare the declaration.   


7-When draft decla is ready, I will review and call client to ask follow up questions if needed. Once complete, I will delegate translation of the declaration. Then, I'll delegate to you to send the declaration to client for review and schedule an appointment to discuss revisions with client/confirmation of declaration and then ensure we get signature.


8-Once client has signed declaration, I will email psychologist Dr. Luis Perez a copy, background, and any supporting evidence such as prior mental health records, kids records, etc, and request a psych eval.


9-When draft evaluation is received, Kevin will review it and compare to the client's declaration to note (1) any new info and (2) any apparent inconsistencies. Once resolved, Kevin will ask for signed version.


10-Once I-589 forms, basic ID dox, additional specific evidence, declaration, pscyh eval, and country conditions are received, we will mail file the application with USCIS by priority mail. NOTE THIS MUST BE FILED BY 6 MONTHS AFTER THECONSULTATION AND THIS DATE IS ON STATUTE OF LIMITATIONS. WE SHOULD ADD A CALENDAR EVENT FOR THESE CASES DUE DATES.  


The asylum packet needs to have an original and then one copy for each additional family member. The signature page needs to have 1 passport photo of client or the family member. When preparing these, we can assemble the PDF digitally and when mailing out carefully confirm that it is a complete digital copy of the entire packet being mailed.


11 - Once I-589 is filed, a 150 day waiting period begins for a work permit, which needs to be noted on the calendar. Also, clients will need to be fingerprinted and return evidence to us. Paralegal should schedule an appointment for 6 months after filing to ensure we have filed the EAD apps and clients have received EAD, and for me to check in. But clients needs to be informed to call if they have questions before this. Also, EAD renewal date needs to be calendared.  


12 - Once asylum interview is scheduled, Will needs to schedule a testimony prep appointment 2 weeks before and ensure we have an interpreter (KMC has referrals and will put in Clio)


Thanks!!!

snippets.name: Asylee AOS
snippets.text:
Case assistant: Jesse

Client(s) names and relationship:

Married couple from Guatemala who were granted asylum (she was principal).  

Background:

They also have a U visa pending that was never withdrawn (would do so if they are granted adjustment).  

Criminal history:

She has no criminal history. He has an arrest on suspicion of DV but no charges.

Grounds of inadmissibility that apply:

Special humanitarian factors to emphasize:

Scope:

Scope now includes filing asylee AOS applications for both.

Jesse, please:

Ensure aspirational deadline to file of 60 days following date of receipt of initial deposit is on calendar as DUE date
Ensure contact information is complete, matter is set up with you as case assistant, both clients associated, correct language selected, and case type is set as USCIS AOS.
Ensure admin has scheduled client welcome call within 3 days of hire  

1-Schedule both clients for forms prep appt
2-Refer them to get their I-693 medical exams using USCIS civil surgeon website
3-Prep I-485, I-602, for both.  

3-Packet should include

G-28
I-485
I-602
Asylum approval notice
Copy of A05 EAD card
Copy of most recent passport (photo page)
Birth certificate for applicant
Marriage cert
Birth certificates for children
Psych eval for Mariela.

Let me know if you have questions. Thanks!
